It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color, which attract specific pollinators. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
